properties.name: 1st Duty Station, 8th Engineer Barracks @ Fort Hood
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflashfort hood texasMy first permanent duty station in the Army. I still can\'t believe I spent 3 years within 45 minutes of Austin and never even heard of SXSW. I was here from Feburary 1999 through January 2001.

properties.name: 3rd House
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash Rented this place for about a year, 1985-1986.

properties.name: 5th house
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash wood creek place, pleasant hill, caThis house was really nice, we had it built custom. My shoe is probably still buried somewhere on the property from when I lost it in a rain storm. There was a nice tree in the backyard that I liked to climb in and pretend I was John Dunbar all alone in my outpost on the frontier. The pool is a recent addition.

properties.name: 8th house
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash6350 Eubank NE, Albuquerque, NM We lived in these apartments for about 6 months when we first moved to Albuquerque. The main thing I remember is not knowing anyone and playing a lot of Day of the Tentacle.

properties.name: 9th house
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash6421 glen oak ne, albuquerque, nmWe lived in this house for a long time. My parents live there still. I\'m being delibrartly ambigious for security.

properties.name: AIT, 187th Ordinance Batallion
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash Strom Thurmond Boulevard, fort jackson, scThis is where I went to AIT. It was night and day from basic training, which was quite a relief. I was here from Novemeber 1998 through Feburary 1999.

properties.name: Alameda Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash412 alameda, Albuquerque, NM

properties.name: BCT, Bravo Battery, 1-22 FA Batallion
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash 6115 NE Rothwell Road, fort sill, okMy basic training batallion. I was here from approximately September 1st through October 31st. I was held back at the FTB(Fat Training Battery) for another week until I passed my pushups, then delayed for a week while my paperwork was processed.

properties.name: Contra Costa Canal Trail
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash   Muir Road, Martinez, caThis is a really great bicycle/jogging/walking trail. There are tons of cool things to see, and it feels like you\'re not in the suburbs anymore.

properties.name: Leesville Road Middle School
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash  8405 Leesville Road, raleigh, ncI went to 6th and 7th grades here. It was ok. There was a technology class that was cool, and a computer club that introduced me to the wonders of Star Control and multiplayer gaming.

properties.name: Nana's Italian Ristorante
properties.description: Posted by JonnyflashA great little Italian place. It has some bad reviews floating around on the web, but they must be from before the owner\'s changed. Basically, its changed ownership twice in the past 2 years. When I first went there, 2 years ago, it was great. Then it was bought out and they changed it and it was awful when I went back. But I noticed they were bought out again a couple months back, and now they are awesome! Try any of their pesto dishes, you will not regret it. Big portions, sometimes a bit slow, but the food is great.

properties.name: Our Lady of Mt. Carmel Cemetery
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash7804 edith blvd, Albuquerque, NM

properties.name: Red House Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Sschultz red house cafe pacific grove, caOne of favorite restuarants in town.

properties.name: Relish Cheese Market and Sandwich Shop
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash 8019 Menaul Blvd albuquerque nmSimply the best place to get a sandwich in Albuquerque. They make their own mozarella cheese fresh daily, its never refridgerated. The Hot Roast Beef, the Cubano, the Plowman\'s Lunch, the cold Turkey are all awesome!

properties.name: Supper Rock Park
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash  13801 encantado, albuquerque nmThis is a really great park in ABQ, with a giant rock that is easy to climb. Go at sunset to get a great view of the sunset and the city lights. Be careful climbing down in the dark!

properties.name: US Army Reception, 95th AG Batallion
properties.description: Posted by Jonnyflash2858 Davidson Road, Fort Sill, OKFort Sill Reception, my intro the the Army. I was here for about 2 weeks, the end of August, 1998.
